feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:43AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...UNSEASONABLY STRONG STORM SYSTEM TO BRING GUSTY WINDS AND HEAVY RAIN TO THE EASTERN ALEUTIANS THROUGH TODAY... A low pressure system moving across the Eastern Aleutians and western Alaska Peninsula is expected to quickly intensify today. As a result, expect increasing winds to gale force with higher gusts up to 55 kts in the midday hours, especially through Unimak

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 1:04PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Near Freezing Temperatures Tonight... As skies clear this afternoon and evening, cold temperatures will develop tonight. Cold valley areas across the Tanana Valley and Central Interior may dip below freezing, with patchy fog conditions possible as well. Residents should take proper precautions with gardens and plants

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 10:16AM CDT until August 10 at 10:50AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1050 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTH CENTRAL WHITE, SOUTHEASTERN CLEBURNE AND SOUTHWESTERN INDEPENDENCE COUNTIES... At 1016 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 09 at 10:24PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * WHAT...Surf of 9 to 11 feet. * WHERE...East facing shores of all islands. * WHEN...through Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor. entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 10 at 3:15AM PDT until August 10 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Strong winds aloft will gradually mix downward to all elevations Wednesday afternoon and evening. Gusty south to southwest winds combined with low RH and recent fire starts will lead to critical fire weather conditions Wednesday afternoon and evening in south central Oregon and northeast California. Critical fire weather conditions may return to northeast Siskiyou and northwest Modoc
